intro: Angorkis superba, commonly known as the golden crown fern, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its large, ornate fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant features a creeping rhizome with dark green, lance-shaped leaves that are often adorned with yellow or golden veins. Angorkis superba thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and indoor plant collections.
